item.title: Carlo Rovelli’s radical perspective on reality
item.description:
Home Carlo Rovelli’s Radical Perspective on Reality Comment Save Article Read Later Share Facebook Copied. Comment Save Article Read Later There is no objective reality, according to Rovelli — only perspectives. We have two main theories that work incredibly well for different domains: general relativity and quantum mechanics.

item.title: OS/2 Warp, PowerPC Edition

), IBM finally “shipped” OS/2 Warp, PowerPC edition. The desktop Power Series machines were IDE based, ThinkPads used SCSI disks. The Power Series systems were closely related to certain IBM RS/6000 workstations.

item.title: How the U.S. National Science Foundation Enabled Software-Defined Networking
item.description:
All of this changed with software-defined networking (SDN), where network owners took control over how their networks behaved. First, network devices should offer a common open interface directly to their packet-forwarding logic. Second, a network should have logically centralized control, where the control software has network-wide visibility and direct control across the distributed collection of network devices.

Read more

item.title: Raspberry Pi Pico Bit-Bangs 100 Mbit/S Ethernet
item.description:
Brian Tristam Williams Raspberry Pi RP2040 or RP2350 Bit-Bangs 100 Mbit/s Ethernet October 22, 2025 by Brian Tristam Williams on Embedded Programming Raspberry Pi RP2040 Raspberry Pi Pico + Wireless & Communication Embedded & AI Embedded AI News Wireless Communication News RP2350 Three years after the popular Pico-10BASE-T experiment and following bit-banged USB in 2023, developer Steve Markgraf now bit-bangs 100 Mbit/s Fast Ethernet on the Raspberry Pi Pico using only software and PIO. Bit-banging 100 Mbps Ethernet on a Raspberry Pi Pico. Get Started with MicroPython on Raspberry Pi Pico (2nd Edition) €18.

Read more

item.title: Crunchyroll is destroying its subtitles for no good reason
item.description:
For comparison, here’s the kind of presentation quality that first-party subtitles were providing just earlier this year: Screenshot from Ruri Rocks (Summer 2025, Crunchyroll) Screenshot from Ruri Rocks (Summer 2025, Crunchyroll) Screenshot from Ruri Rocks (Summer 2025, Crunchyroll) Screenshot from Ruri Rocks (Summer 2025, Crunchyroll) Given the technical capabilities on display in the above screenshots, it should be clear that first-party subtitles for Fall 2025 shows shouldn’t look as bad as they do. Lots of on-screen text is even left straight up untranslated. Screenshot from The Demon Girl Next Door (Summer 2019, Hidive) Screenshot from Is the Order a Rabbit.

Read more

item.title: Meta and TikTok are obstructing researchers' access to data, EU commission rules
Detour: Dynamic linking on Linux without Libc
item.description:
At its core, Detour is a minimal bootstrap layer that gives your application access to the system dynamic linker ld-linux. Detour works in both static and dynamic contexts. It works like this: We provide a tiny stub ELF executable that is dynamically linked against the system dynamic linker.

item.title: The Internet Runs on Free and Open Source Software–and So Does the DNS

SAC132 provides timely, nontechnical guidance to ensure that new policy and regulation serve to strengthen, rather than inadvertently weaken, this critical infrastructure. Key Insights for Policymakers SAC132 is a foundational guide designed to empower policymakers to strategically manage and sustain the FOSS ecosystem. We invite all policymakers, technical experts, and stakeholders to read the full report.

item.title: Tell HN: Twilio support replies with hallucinated features
item.description:
I was investigating some bug with our voice system and asked support where I can find some debugging information and event logs. They told me where I should go in the interface to see that and reassured that they checked logs and this event exist. The support message with hallucinated features is mostly AI written.

Read more

item.title: Building a Robot Dog (with an airsoft gun)
item.description:
This blog covers my design process, stress testing, and final robot that I built :) After watching some videos of past competitions, I decided that my strategy would be to maximize speed so I could attack opponents from the side and back before they realized what was happening. These are the equations that let you convert between foot X,Y coordinates, and motor angles (theta1, theta2) between each other. This was a really valuable exercise to build design intuition and how all these variables related to each other.

Read more

item.title: Cursor Composer: Building a fast frontier model with RL
item.description:
Blog / ResearchComposer is our new agent model designed for software engineering intelligence and speed. On our benchmarks, the model achieves frontier coding results with generation speed four times faster than similar models. Reinforcement learning allows us to actively specialize the model for effective software engineering.

Read more
